unnormalised: Alright folks, buckle up! The Indian automotive scene is buzzing with new vehicle launches, hotter than a Delhi summer!
normalised: Alright folks, buckle up! The Indian automotive scene is buzzing with new vehicle launches, hotter than a Delhi summer!

unnormalised: First up, Mahindra dropped the new Scorpio N Adventure Edition at a starting price we're still drooling over! Looks like it’s ready for some serious off-roading from Leh to Kanyakumari. Expect chunky tires and maybe even a rooftop tent!
normalised: First up, Mahindra dropped the new Scorpio N Adventure Edition at a starting price we're still drooling over! Looks like it’s ready for some serious off-roading from Leh to Kanyakumari. Expect chunky tires and maybe even a rooftop tent!

unnormalised: Then, Tata Motors finally unveiled their much-awaited Altroz EV. Dr. Sharma from ARAI gave it a thumbs up. Word on the street is it's got a range of around 350 km on a single charge, perfect for zipping around Mumbai.
normalised: Then, Tata Motors finally unveiled their much-awaited Altroz E V. Doctor Sharma from A R A I gave it a thumbs up. Word on the street is it's got a range of around three hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge, perfect for zipping around Mumbai.

unnormalised: Not to be left behind, Maruti Suzuki quietly launched a limited-edition WagonR with extra features like a touchscreen infotainment system and snazzier interiors. Perfect for that family trip to Agra.
normalised: Not to be left behind, Maruti Suzuki quietly launched a limited-edition Wagon R with extra features like a touchscreen infotainment system and snazzier interiors. Perfect for that family trip to Agra.

unnormalised: And lastly, a homegrown EV startup, Ola, showcased their new scooter design. Claims it offers class-leading storage – enough to stash a whole box of laddoos! Their new factory in Tamil Nadu boasts over 2 million sq ft. Price rumoured to be below Rs. 1 Lakh. Keep your eyes peeled for more updates!
normalised: And lastly, a homegrown E V startup, Ola, showcased their new scooter design. Claims it offers class-leading storage – enough to stash a whole box of laddoos! Their new factory in Tamil Nadu boasts over two million square feet. Price rumoured to be below rupee one lakh. Keep your eyes peeled for more updates!
